About Me

Greetings!

My name is Michael Yuan, and welcome to my personal website. I was born in Plano, Texas on August 7, 1998, and have lived in Texas ever since.

My parents are my inspiration. They immigrated from China to New York for their graduate degrees. My dad attended Cornell University and my mom attended the Rochester Institute of Technology. I have an awesome older sister named Christine and a cute dog named Snowy.

When I was young, I had a curiosity for almost everything in this world. These curiosities ultimately culminated into a passion for math, logic, and technology. When I was young, I snuck into a chess class and went on to play chess for five more years. I participated in different math competitions and loved solving brain teasers. I fell in love with the beauty of logic and math and was amazed by how a manmade language could imitate nature so flawlessly. When I got my first phone, I was addicted to technology and learned more about computer science. I was so intrigued with using technology as a medium to connect with other and to help others by solving problems that were previously unsolvable.

These interests made me want to learn more knowledge about those subjects. I attended the Texas Academy of Math and Science, and used my mathematical and technical abilities in biological research projects with university professors. I am now an Operations Research major and a Computer Science minor. I now attend Cornell University as well, hoping to follow and ultimately overtake my dad's footsteps.

Although I am mostly interested in math and technology, I am fascinated with many other wonders of this world. I'm a sports enthusiast and a giant history and humanities buff. I am a foodie and a Settler of Catan. I aspire to be the quintessential man, and intend to enjoy my journey along the way.
